name: Melting Glaciers
abstract: The data in this infographic highlights the accelerating impact of global warming on global ice loss. It shows how greenhouse gas emissions from industry, energy use, and farming contribute to rising temperatures, which in turn speed up glacier melting in both polar regions. The infographic presents trends in Antarctic and Arctic ice decline, changes in sea level, and the ecological consequences for animals, plants, and coastal communities. It offers a clear visual overview of how ice distribution is shifting and why these changes matter for the environment and human society.
